snippet: Lleyton Hewitt, like Roger Federer, is 32 and was once No. 1 in the world, but he has moved on from those increasingly distant days and found meaning at a new, lower level.
abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column examines career of Lleyton Hewitt, former top-ranked tennis player who has found meaning playing at new, albeit lower, level; contends that Hewitt's graceful denouement could provide a lesson for Roger Federer as he faces declining powers.
lead_paragraph: Lleyton Hewitt, like Roger Federer, is 32 and was once No. 1 in the world, but he has moved on from those increasingly distant days and found meaning at a new, lower level.

headline.main: A Lesson in Adjusting to Lower Expectations
headline.print_headline: A Lesson in Adjusting To Lower Expectations
